summary: Over the 6‑hour window winds averaged about 12.65 m/s with a peak gust to 30.2 m/s, while electrical output stayed high and stable (power mean ≈0.95, std ≈0.022) with a modest positive residual (~0.125). Rotational and control signals show atypical behavior: rotor speed recorded no variability while generator speed had small fluctuations, pitch averaged ~3.54 and yaw misalignment ~2.48; temperatures were elevated (mean ≈73.97). Overall operational status flags remained normal throughout the window despite the noted gust and the lack of rotor speed variation.
